text: How do I convert part of a python tuple (byte array) into an integer
I am trying to talk to a device using python.
I have been handed a tuple of bytes which contains the storage information.
How can I convert the data into the correct values:
The first 4 values are a 32-bit int telling me how many bytes have been used and the last value is the percentage used.
I can access the tuple as response[0] but cannot see how I can get the first 4 values into the int I require.
